speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: Who keeps the gate here, ho?

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: Where is the earl?

speaker: Porter
line: What shall I say you are?

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: Tell thou the earl

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: That the Lord Bardolph doth attend him here.

speaker: Porter
line: His lordship is walk'd forth into the orchard;

speaker: Porter
line: Please it your honour, knock but at the gate,

speaker: Porter
line: And he himself wilt answer.

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: Here comes the earl.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: What news, Lord Bardolph? every minute now

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Should be the father of some stratagem:

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: The times are wild: contention, like a horse

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Full of high feeding, madly hath broke loose

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: And bears down all before him.

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: Noble earl,

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: I bring you certain news from Shrewsbury.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Good, an God will!

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: As good as heart can wish:

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: The king is almost wounded to the death;

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: And, in the fortune of my lord your son,

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: Prince Harry slain outright; and both the Blunts

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: Kill'd by the hand of Douglas; young Prince John

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: And Westmoreland and Stafford fled the field;

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: And Harry Monmouth's brawn, the hulk Sir John,

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: Is prisoner to your son: O, such a day,

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: So fought, so follow'd and so fairly won,

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: Came not till now to dignify the times,

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: Since Caesar's fortunes!

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: How is this derived?

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Saw you the field? came you from Shrewsbury?

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: I spake with one, my lord, that came from thence,

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: A gentleman well bred and of good name,

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: That freely render'd me these news for true.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Here comes my servant Travers, whom I sent

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: On Tuesday last to listen after news.

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: My lord, I over-rode him on the way;

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: And he is furnish'd with no certainties

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: More than he haply may retail from me.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Now, Travers, what good tidings comes with you?

speaker: TRAVERS
line: My lord, Sir John Umfrevile turn'd me back

speaker: TRAVERS
line: With joyful tidings; and, being better horsed,

speaker: TRAVERS
line: Out-rode me. After him came spurring hard

speaker: TRAVERS
line: A gentleman, almost forspent with speed,

speaker: TRAVERS
line: That stopp'd by me to breathe his bloodied horse.

speaker: TRAVERS
line: He ask'd the way to Chester; and of him

speaker: TRAVERS
line: I did demand what news from Shrewsbury:

speaker: TRAVERS
line: He told me that rebellion had bad luck

speaker: TRAVERS
line: And that young Harry Percy's spur was cold.

speaker: TRAVERS
line: With that, he gave his able horse the head,

speaker: TRAVERS
line: And bending forward struck his armed heels

speaker: TRAVERS
line: Against the panting sides of his poor jade

speaker: TRAVERS
line: Up to the rowel-head, and starting so

speaker: TRAVERS
line: He seem'd in running to devour the way,

speaker: TRAVERS
line: Staying no longer question.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Ha! Again:

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Said he young Harry Percy's spur was cold?

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Of Hotspur Coldspur? that rebellion

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Had met ill luck?

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: My lord, I'll tell you what;

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: If my young lord your son have not the day,

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: Upon mine honour, for a silken point

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: I'll give my barony: never talk of it.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Why should that gentleman that rode by Travers

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Give then such instances of loss?

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: Who, he?

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: He was some hilding fellow that had stolen

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: The horse he rode on, and, upon my life,

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: Spoke at a venture. Look, here comes more news.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Yea, this man's brow, like to a title-leaf,

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Foretells the nature of a tragic volume:

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: So looks the strand whereon the imperious flood

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Hath left a witness'd usurpation.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Say, Morton, didst thou come from Shrewsbury?

speaker: MORTON
line: I ran from Shrewsbury, my noble lord;

speaker: MORTON
line: Where hateful death put on his ugliest mask

speaker: MORTON
line: To fright our party.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: How doth my son and brother?

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Thou tremblest; and the whiteness in thy cheek

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Is apter than thy tongue to tell thy errand.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Even such a man, so faint, so spiritless,

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: So dull, so dead in look, so woe-begone,

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Drew Priam's curtain in the dead of night,

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: And would have told him half his Troy was burnt;

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: But Priam found the fire ere he his tongue,

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: And I my Percy's death ere thou report'st it.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: This thou wouldst say, 'Your son did thus and thus;

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Your brother thus: so fought the noble Douglas:'

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Stopping my greedy ear with their bold deeds:

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: But in the end, to stop my ear indeed,

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Thou hast a sigh to blow away this praise,

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Ending with 'Brother, son, and all are dead.'

speaker: MORTON
line: Douglas is living, and your brother, yet;

speaker: MORTON
line: But, for my lord your son--

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Why, he is dead.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: See what a ready tongue suspicion hath!

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: He that but fears the thing he would not know

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Hath by instinct knowledge from others' eyes

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: That what he fear'd is chanced. Yet speak, Morton;

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Tell thou an earl his divination lies,

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: And I will take it as a sweet disgrace

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: And make thee rich for doing me such wrong.

speaker: MORTON
line: You are too great to be by me gainsaid:

speaker: MORTON
line: Your spirit is too true, your fears too certain.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Yet, for all this, say not that Percy's dead.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: I see a strange confession in thine eye:

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Thou shakest thy head and hold'st it fear or sin

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: To speak a truth. If he be slain, say so;

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: The tongue offends not that reports his death:

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: And he doth sin that doth belie the dead,

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Not he which says the dead is not alive.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Yet the first bringer of unwelcome news

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Hath but a losing office, and his tongue

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Sounds ever after as a sullen bell,

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Remember'd tolling a departing friend.

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: I cannot think, my lord, your son is dead.

speaker: MORTON
line: I am sorry I should force you to believe

speaker: MORTON
line: That which I would to God I had not seen;

speaker: MORTON
line: But these mine eyes saw him in bloody state,

speaker: MORTON
line: Rendering faint quittance, wearied and out-breathed,

speaker: MORTON
line: To Harry Monmouth; whose swift wrath beat down

speaker: MORTON
line: The never-daunted Percy to the earth,

speaker: MORTON
line: From whence with life he never more sprung up.

speaker: MORTON
line: In few, his death, whose spirit lent a fire

speaker: MORTON
line: Even to the dullest peasant in his camp,

speaker: MORTON
line: Being bruited once, took fire and heat away

speaker: MORTON
line: From the best temper'd courage in his troops;

speaker: MORTON
line: For from his metal was his party steel'd;

speaker: MORTON
line: Which once in him abated, all the rest

speaker: MORTON
line: Turn'd on themselves, like dull and heavy lead:

speaker: MORTON
line: And as the thing that's heavy in itself,

speaker: MORTON
line: Upon enforcement flies with greatest speed,

speaker: MORTON
line: So did our men, heavy in Hotspur's loss,

speaker: MORTON
line: Lend to this weight such lightness with their fear

speaker: MORTON
line: That arrows fled not swifter toward their aim

speaker: MORTON
line: Than did our soldiers, aiming at their safety,

speaker: MORTON
line: Fly from the field. Then was the noble Worcester

speaker: MORTON
line: Too soon ta'en prisoner; and that furious Scot,

speaker: MORTON
line: The bloody Douglas, whose well-labouring sword

speaker: MORTON
line: Had three times slain the appearance of the king,

speaker: MORTON
line: 'Gan vail his stomach and did grace the shame

speaker: MORTON
line: Of those that turn'd their backs, and in his flight,

speaker: MORTON
line: Stumbling in fear, was took. The sum of all

speaker: MORTON
line: Is that the king hath won, and hath sent out

speaker: MORTON
line: A speedy power to encounter you, my lord,

speaker: MORTON
line: Under the conduct of young Lancaster

speaker: MORTON
line: And Westmoreland. This is the news at full.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: For this I shall have time enough to mourn.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: In poison there is physic; and these news,

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Having been well, that would have made me sick,

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Being sick, have in some measure made me well:

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: And as the wretch, whose fever-weaken'd joints,

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Like strengthless hinges, buckle under life,

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Impatient of his fit, breaks like a fire

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Out of his keeper's arms, even so my limbs,

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Weaken'd with grief, being now enraged with grief,

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Are thrice themselves. Hence, therefore, thou nice crutch!

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: A scaly gauntlet now with joints of steel

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Must glove this hand: and hence, thou sickly quoif!

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Thou art a guard too wanton for the head

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Which princes, flesh'd with conquest, aim to hit.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Now bind my brows with iron; and approach

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: The ragged'st hour that time and spite dare bring

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: To frown upon the enraged Northumberland!

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Let heaven kiss earth! now let not Nature's hand

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Keep the wild flood confined! let order die!

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: And let this world no longer be a stage

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: To feed contention in a lingering act;

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: But let one spirit of the first-born Cain

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Reign in all bosoms, that, each heart being set

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: On bloody courses, the rude scene may end,

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: And darkness be the burier of the dead!

speaker: TRAVERS
line: This strained passion doth you wrong, my lord.

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: Sweet earl, divorce not wisdom from your honour.

speaker: MORTON
line: The lives of all your loving complices

speaker: MORTON
line: Lean on your health; the which, if you give o'er

speaker: MORTON
line: To stormy passion, must perforce decay.

speaker: MORTON
line: You cast the event of war, my noble lord,

speaker: MORTON
line: And summ'd the account of chance, before you said

speaker: MORTON
line: 'Let us make head.' It was your presurmise,

speaker: MORTON
line: That, in the dole of blows, your son might drop:

speaker: MORTON
line: You knew he walk'd o'er perils, on an edge,

speaker: MORTON
line: More likely to fall in than to get o'er;

speaker: MORTON
line: You were advised his flesh was capable

speaker: MORTON
line: Of wounds and scars and that his forward spirit

speaker: MORTON
line: Would lift him where most trade of danger ranged:

speaker: MORTON
line: Yet did you say 'Go forth;' and none of this,

speaker: MORTON
line: Though strongly apprehended, could restrain

speaker: MORTON
line: The stiff-borne action: what hath then befallen,

speaker: MORTON
line: Or what hath this bold enterprise brought forth,

speaker: MORTON
line: More than that being which was like to be?

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: We all that are engaged to this loss

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: Knew that we ventured on such dangerous seas

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: That if we wrought our life 'twas ten to one;

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: And yet we ventured, for the gain proposed

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: Choked the respect of likely peril fear'd;

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: And since we are o'erset, venture again.

speaker: LORD BARDOLPH
line: Come, we will all put forth, body and goods.

speaker: MORTON
line: 'Tis more than time: and, my most noble lord,

speaker: MORTON
line: I hear for certain, and do speak the truth,

speaker: MORTON
line: The gentle Archbishop of York is up

speaker: MORTON
line: With well-appointed powers: he is a man

speaker: MORTON
line: Who with a double surety binds his followers.

speaker: MORTON
line: My lord your son had only but the corpse,

speaker: MORTON
line: But shadows and the shows of men, to fight;

speaker: MORTON
line: For that same word, rebellion, did divide

speaker: MORTON
line: The action of their bodies from their souls;

speaker: MORTON
line: And they did fight with queasiness, constrain'd,

speaker: MORTON
line: As men drink potions, that their weapons only

speaker: MORTON
line: Seem'd on our side; but, for their spirits and souls,

speaker: MORTON
line: This word, rebellion, it had froze them up,

speaker: MORTON
line: As fish are in a pond. But now the bishop

speaker: MORTON
line: Turns insurrection to religion:

speaker: MORTON
line: Supposed sincere and holy in his thoughts,

speaker: MORTON
line: He's followed both with body and with mind;

speaker: MORTON
line: And doth enlarge his rising with the blood

speaker: MORTON
line: Of fair King Richard, scraped from Pomfret stones;

speaker: MORTON
line: Derives from heaven his quarrel and his cause;

speaker: MORTON
line: Tells them he doth bestride a bleeding land,

speaker: MORTON
line: Gasping for life under great Bolingbroke;

speaker: MORTON
line: And more and less do flock to follow him.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: I knew of this before; but, to speak truth,

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: This present grief had wiped it from my mind.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Go in with me; and counsel every man

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: The aptest way for safety and revenge:

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Get posts and letters, and make friends with speed:

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Never so few, and never yet more need.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Sirrah, you giant, what says the doctor to my water?

speaker: Page
line: He said, sir, the water itself was a good healthy

speaker: Page
line: water; but, for the party that owed it, he might

speaker: Page
line: have more diseases than he knew for.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Men of all sorts take a pride to gird at me: the

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: brain of this foolish-compounded clay, man, is not

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: able to invent anything that tends to laughter, more

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: than I invent or is invented on me: I am not only

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: witty in myself, but the cause that wit is in other

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: men. I do here walk before thee like a sow that

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: hath overwhelmed all her litter but one. If the

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: prince put thee into my service for any other reason

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: than to set me off, why then I have no judgment.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Thou whoreson mandrake, thou art fitter to be worn

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: in my cap than to wait at my heels. I was never

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: manned with an agate till now: but I will inset you

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: neither in gold nor silver, but in vile apparel, and

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: send you back again to your master, for a jewel,--

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: the juvenal, the prince your master, whose chin is

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: not yet fledged. I will sooner have a beard grow in

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: the palm of my hand than he shall get one on his

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: cheek; and yet he will not stick to say his face is

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: a face-royal: God may finish it when he will, 'tis

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: not a hair amiss yet: he may keep it still at a

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: face-royal, for a barber shall never earn sixpence

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: out of it; and yet he'll be crowing as if he had

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: writ man ever since his father was a bachelor. He

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: may keep his own grace, but he's almost out of mine,

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: I can assure him. What said Master Dombledon about

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: the satin for my short cloak and my slops?

speaker: Page
line: He said, sir, you should procure him better

speaker: Page
line: assurance than Bardolph: he would not take his

speaker: Page
line: band and yours; he liked not the security.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Let him be damned, like the glutton! pray God his

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: tongue be hotter! A whoreson Achitophel! a rascally

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: yea-forsooth knave! to bear a gentleman in hand,

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: and then stand upon security! The whoreson

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: smooth-pates do now wear nothing but high shoes, and

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: bunches of keys at their girdles; and if a man is

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: through with them in honest taking up, then they

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: must stand upon security. I had as lief they would

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: put ratsbane in my mouth as offer to stop it with

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: security. I looked a' should have sent me two and

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: twenty yards of satin, as I am a true knight, and he

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: sends me security. Well, he may sleep in security;

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: for he hath the horn of abundance, and the lightness

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: of his wife shines through it: and yet cannot he

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: see, though he have his own lanthorn to light him.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Where's Bardolph?

speaker: Page
line: He's gone into Smithfield to buy your worship a horse.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: I bought him in Paul's, and he'll buy me a horse in

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Smithfield: an I could get me but a wife in the

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: stews, I were manned, horsed, and wived.

speaker: Page
line: Sir, here comes the nobleman that committed the

speaker: Page
line: Prince for striking him about Bardolph.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Wait, close; I will not see him.

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: What's he that goes there?

speaker: Servant
line: Falstaff, an't please your lordship.

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: He that was in question for the robbery?

speaker: Servant
line: He, my lord: but he hath since done good service at

speaker: Servant
line: Shrewsbury; and, as I hear, is now going with some

speaker: Servant
line: charge to the Lord John of Lancaster.

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: What, to York? Call him back again.

speaker: Servant
line: Sir John Falstaff!

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Boy, tell him I am deaf.

speaker: Page
line: You must speak louder; my master is deaf.

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: I am sure he is, to the hearing of any thing good.

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: Go, pluck him by the elbow; I must speak with him.

speaker: Servant
line: Sir John!

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: What! a young knave, and begging! Is there not

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: wars? is there not employment? doth not the king

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: lack subjects? do not the rebels need soldiers?

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Though it be a shame to be on any side but one, it

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: is worse shame to beg than to be on the worst side,

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: were it worse than the name of rebellion can tell

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: how to make it.

speaker: Servant
line: You mistake me, sir.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Why, sir, did I say you were an honest man? setting

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: my knighthood and my soldiership aside, I had lied

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: in my throat, if I had said so.

speaker: Servant
line: I pray you, sir, then set your knighthood and our

speaker: Servant
line: soldiership aside; and give me leave to tell you,

speaker: Servant
line: you lie in your throat, if you say I am any other

speaker: Servant
line: than an honest man.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: I give thee leave to tell me so! I lay aside that

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: which grows to me! if thou gettest any leave of me,

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: hang me; if thou takest leave, thou wert better be

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: hanged. You hunt counter: hence! avaunt!

speaker: Servant
line: Sir, my lord would speak with you.

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: Sir John Falstaff, a word with you.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: My good lord! God give your lordship good time of

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: day. I am glad to see your lordship abroad: I heard

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: say your lordship was sick: I hope your lordship

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: goes abroad by advice. Your lordship, though not

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: clean past your youth, hath yet some smack of age in

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: you, some relish of the saltness of time; and I must

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: humbly beseech your lordship to have a reverent care

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: of your health.

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: Sir John, I sent for you before your expedition to

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: Shrewsbury.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: An't please your lordship, I hear his majesty is

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: returned with some discomfort from Wales.

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: I talk not of his majesty: you would not come when

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: I sent for you.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: And I hear, moreover, his highness is fallen into

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: this same whoreson apoplexy.

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: Well, God mend him! I pray you, let me speak with

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: you.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: This apoplexy is, as I take it, a kind of lethargy,

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: an't please your lordship; a kind of sleeping in the

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: blood, a whoreson tingling.

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: What tell you me of it? be it as it is.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: It hath its original from much grief, from study and

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: perturbation of the brain: I have read the cause of

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: his effects in Galen: it is a kind of deafness.

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: I think you are fallen into the disease; for you

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: hear not what I say to you.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Very well, my lord, very well: rather, an't please

speaker: FALSTAFF

line: Stand from him, fellow: wherefore hang'st upon him?

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: O most worshipful lord, an't please your grace, I am

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: a poor widow of Eastcheap, and he is arrested at my suit.

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: For what sum?

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: It is more than for some, my lord; it is for all,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: all I have. He hath eaten me out of house and home;

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: he hath put all my substance into that fat belly of

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: his: but I will have some of it out again, or I

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: will ride thee o' nights like the mare.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: I think I am as like to ride the mare, if I have

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: any vantage of ground to get up.

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: How comes this, Sir John? Fie! what man of good

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: temper would endure this tempest of exclamation?

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: Are you not ashamed to enforce a poor widow to so

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: rough a course to come by her own?

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: What is the gross sum that I owe thee?

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: Marry, if thou wert an honest man, thyself and the

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: money too. Thou didst swear to me upon a

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: parcel-gilt goblet, sitting in my Dolphin-chamber,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: at the round table, by a sea-coal fire, upon

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: Wednesday in Wheeson week, when the prince broke

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: thy head for liking his father to a singing-man of

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: Windsor, thou didst swear to me then, as I was

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: washing thy wound, to marry me and make me my lady

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: thy wife. Canst thou deny it? Did not goodwife

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: Keech, the butcher's wife, come in then and call me

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: gossip Quickly? coming in to borrow a mess of

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: vinegar; telling us she had a good dish of prawns;

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: whereby thou didst desire to eat some; whereby I

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: told thee they were ill for a green wound? And

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: didst thou not, when she was gone down stairs,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: desire me to be no more so familiarity with such

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: poor people; saying that ere long they should call

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: me madam? And didst thou not kiss me and bid me

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: fetch thee thirty shillings? I put thee now to thy

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: book-oath: deny it, if thou canst.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: My lord, this is a poor mad soul; and she says up

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: and down the town that the eldest son is like you:

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: she hath been in good case, and the truth is,

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: poverty hath distracted her. But for these foolish

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: officers, I beseech you I may have redress against them.

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: Sir John, Sir John, I am well acquainted with your

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: manner of wrenching the true cause the false way. It

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: is not a confident brow, nor the throng of words

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: that come with such more than impudent sauciness

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: from you, can thrust me from a level consideration:

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: you have, as it appears to me, practised upon the

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: easy-yielding spirit of this woman, and made her

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: serve your uses both in purse and in person.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: Yea, in truth, my lord.

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: Pray thee, peace. Pay her the debt you owe her, and

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: unpay the villany you have done her: the one you

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: may do with sterling money, and the other with

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: current repentance.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: My lord, I will not undergo this sneap without

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: reply. You call honourable boldness impudent

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: sauciness: if a man will make courtesy and say

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: nothing, he is virtuous: no, my lord, my humble

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: duty remembered, I will not be your suitor. I say

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: to you, I do desire deliverance from these officers,

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: being upon hasty employment in the king's affairs.

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: You speak as having power to do wrong: but answer

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: in the effect of your reputation, and satisfy this

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: poor woman.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Come hither, hostess.

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: Now, Master Gower, what news?

speaker: GOWER
line: The king, my lord, and Harry Prince of Wales

speaker: GOWER
line: Are near at hand: the rest the paper tells.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: As I am a gentleman.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: Faith, you said so before.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: As I am a gentleman. Come, no more words of it.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: By this heavenly ground I tread on, I must be fain

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: to pawn both my plate and the tapestry of my

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: dining-chambers.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Glasses, glasses is the only drinking: and for thy

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: walls, a pretty slight drollery, or the story of

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: the Prodigal, or the German hunting in water-work,

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: is worth a thousand of these bed-hangings and these

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: fly-bitten tapestries. Let it be ten pound, if thou

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: canst. Come, an 'twere not for thy humours, there's

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: not a better wench in England. Go, wash thy face,

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: and draw the action. Come, thou must not be in

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: this humour with me; dost not know me? come, come, I

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: know thou wast set on to this.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: Pray thee, Sir John, let it be but twenty nobles: i'

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: faith, I am loath to pawn my plate, so God save me,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: la!

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Let it alone; I'll make other shift: you'll be a

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: fool still.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: Well, you shall have it, though I pawn my gown. I

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: hope you'll come to supper. You'll pay me all together?

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Will I live?

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Go, with her, with her; hook on, hook on.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: Will you have Doll Tearsheet meet you at supper?

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: No more words; let's have her.

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: I have heard better news.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: What's the news, my lord?

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: Where lay the king last night?

speaker: GOWER
line: At Basingstoke, my lord.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: I hope, my lord, all's well: what is the news, my lord?

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: Come all his forces back?

speaker: GOWER
line: No; fifteen hundred foot, five hundred horse,

speaker: GOWER
line: Are marched up to my lord of Lancaster,

speaker: GOWER
line: Against Northumberland and the Archbishop.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Comes the king back from Wales, my noble lord?

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: You shall have letters of me presently:

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: Come, go along with me, good Master Gower.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: My lord!

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: What's the matter?

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Master Gower, shall I entreat you with me to dinner?

speaker: GOWER
line: I must wait upon my good lord here; I thank you,

speaker: GOWER
line: good Sir John.

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: Sir John, you loiter here too long, being you are to

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: take soldiers up in counties as you go.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Will you sup with me, Master Gower?

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: What foolish master taught you these manners, Sir John?

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Master Gower, if they become me not, he was a fool

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: that taught them me. This is the right fencing

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: grace, my lord; tap for tap, and so part fair.

speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: Now the Lord lighten thee! thou art a great fool.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Before God, I am exceeding weary.

speaker: POINS
line: Is't come to that? I had thought weariness durst not

speaker: POINS
line: have attached one of so high blood.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Faith, it does me; though it discolours the

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: complexion of my greatness to acknowledge it. Doth

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: it not show vilely in me to desire small beer?

speaker: POINS
line: Why, a prince should not be so loosely studied as

speaker: POINS
line: to remember so weak a composition.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Belike then my appetite was not princely got; for,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: by my troth, I do now remember the poor creature,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: small beer. But, indeed, these humble

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: considerations make me out of love with my

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: greatness. What a disgrace is it to me to remember

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: thy name! or to know thy face to-morrow! or to

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: take note how many pair of silk stockings thou

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: hast, viz. these, and those that were thy

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: peach-coloured ones! or to bear the inventory of thy

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: shirts, as, one for superfluity, and another for

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: use! But that the tennis-court-keeper knows better

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: than I; for it is a low ebb of linen with thee when

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: thou keepest not racket there; as thou hast not done

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: a great while, because the rest of thy low

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: countries have made a shift to eat up thy holland:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: and God knows, whether those that bawl out the ruins

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: of thy linen shall inherit his kingdom: but the

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: midwives say the children are not in the fault;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: whereupon the world increases, and kindreds are

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: mightily strengthened.

speaker: POINS
line: How ill it follows, after you have laboured so hard,

speaker: POINS
line: you should talk so idly! Tell me, how many good

speaker: POINS
line: young princes would do so, their fathers being so

speaker: POINS
line: sick as yours at this time is?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Shall I tell thee one thing, Poins?

speaker: POINS
line: Yes, faith; and let it be an excellent good thing.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: It shall serve among wits of no higher breeding than thine.

speaker: POINS
line: Go to; I stand the push of your one thing that you

speaker: POINS
line: will tell.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Marry, I tell thee, it is not meet that I should be

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: sad, now my father is sick: albeit I could tell

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: thee, as to one it pleases me, for fault of a

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: better, to call my friend, I could be sad, and sad

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: indeed too.

speaker: POINS
line: Very hardly upon such a subject.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: By this hand thou thinkest me as far in the devil's

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: book as thou and Falstaff for obduracy and

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: persistency: let the end try the man. But I tell

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: thee, my heart bleeds inwardly that my father is so

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: sick: and keeping such vile company as thou art

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: hath in reason taken from me all ostentation of sorrow.

speaker: POINS
line: The reason?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: What wouldst thou think of me, if I should weep?

speaker: POINS
line: I would think thee a most princely hypocrite.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: It would be every man's thought; and thou art a

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: blessed fellow to think as every man thinks: never

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: a man's thought in the world keeps the road-way

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: better than thine: every man would think me an

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: hypocrite indeed. And what accites your most

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: worshipful thought to think so?

speaker: POINS
line: Why, because you have been so lewd and so much

speaker: POINS
line: engraffed to Falstaff.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And to thee.

speaker: POINS
line: By this light, I am well spoke on; I can hear it

speaker: POINS
line: with my own ears: the worst that they can say of

speaker: POINS
line: me is that I am a second brother and that I am a

speaker: POINS
line: proper fellow of my hands; and those two things, I

speaker: POINS
line: confess, I cannot help. By the mass, here comes Bardolph.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And the boy that I gave Falstaff: a' had him from

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: me Christian; and look, if the fat villain have not

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: transformed him ape.

speaker: BARDOLPH
line: God save your grace!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And yours, most noble Bardolph!

speaker: BARDOLPH
line: Come, you virtuous ass, you bashful fool, must you

speaker: BARDOLPH
line: be blushing? wherefore blush you now? What a

speaker: BARDOLPH
line: maidenly man-at-arms are you become! Is't such a

speaker: BARDOLPH
line: matter to get a pottle-pot's maidenhead?

speaker: Page
line: A' calls me e'en now, my lord, through a red

speaker: Page
line: lattice, and I could discern no part of his face

speaker: Page
line: from the window: at last I spied his eyes, and

speaker: Page
line: methought he had made two holes in the ale-wife's

speaker: Page
line: new petticoat and so peeped through.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Has not the boy profited?

speaker: BARDOLPH
line: Away, you whoreson upright rabbit, away!

speaker: Page
line: Away, you rascally Althaea's dream, away!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Instruct us, boy; what dream, boy?

speaker: Page
line: Marry, my lord, Althaea dreamed she was delivered

speaker: Page
line: of a fire-brand; and therefore I call him her dream.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: A crown's worth of good interpretation: there 'tis,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: boy.

speaker: POINS
line: O, that this good blossom could be kept from

speaker: POINS
line: cankers! Well, there is sixpence to preserve thee.

speaker: BARDOLPH
line: An you do not make him hanged among you, the

speaker: BARDOLPH
line: gallows shall have wrong.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And how doth thy master, Bardolph?

speaker: BARDOLPH
line: Well, my lord. He heard of your grace's coming to

speaker: BARDOLPH
line: town: there's a letter for you.

speaker: POINS
line: Delivered with good respect. And how doth the

speaker: POINS
line: martlemas, your master?

speaker: BARDOLPH
line: In bodily health, sir.

speaker: POINS
line: Marry, the immortal part needs a physician; but

speaker: POINS
line: that moves not him: though that be sick, it dies

speaker: POINS
line: not.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I do allow this wen to be as familiar with me as my

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: dog; and he holds his place; for look you how be writes.

speaker: POINS
line: Reads  'John Falstaff, knight,'--every man must

speaker: POINS
line: know that, as oft as he has occasion to name

speaker: POINS
line: himself: even like those that are kin to the king;

speaker: POINS
line: for they never prick their finger but they say,

speaker: POINS
line: 'There's some of the king's blood spilt.' 'How

speaker: POINS
line: comes that?' says he, that takes upon him not to

speaker: POINS
line: conceive. The answer is as ready as a borrower's

speaker: POINS
line: cap, 'I am the king's poor cousin, sir.'

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Nay, they will be kin to us, or they will fetch it

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: from Japhet. But to the letter.

speaker: POINS
line: Reads  'Sir John Falstaff, knight, to the son of

speaker: POINS
line: the king, nearest his father, Harry Prince of

speaker: POINS
line: Wales, greeting.' Why, this is a certificate.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Peace!

speaker: POINS
line: Reads  'I will imitate the honourable Romans in

speaker: POINS
line: brevity:' he sure means brevity in breath,

speaker: POINS
line: short-winded. 'I commend me to thee, I commend

speaker: POINS
line: thee, and I leave thee. Be not too familiar with

speaker: POINS
line: Poins; for he misuses thy favours so much, that he

speaker: POINS
line: swears thou art to marry his sister Nell. Repent

speaker: POINS
line: at idle times as thou mayest; and so, farewell.

speaker: POINS
line: Thine, by yea and no, which is as much as to

speaker: POINS
line: say, as thou usest him, JACK FALSTAFF with my

speaker: POINS
line: familiars, JOHN with my brothers and sisters,

speaker: POINS
line: and SIR JOHN with all Europe.'

speaker: POINS
line: My lord, I'll steep this letter in sack and make him eat it.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: That's to make him eat twenty of his words. But do

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: you use me thus, Ned? must I marry your sister?

speaker: POINS
line: God send the wench no worse fortune! But I never said so.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Well, thus we play the fools with the time, and the

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: spirits of the wise sit in the clouds and mock us.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Is your master here in London?

speaker: BARDOLPH
line: Yea, my lord.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Where sups he? doth the old boar feed in the old frank?

speaker: BARDOLPH
line: At the old place, my lord, in Eastcheap.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: What company?

speaker: Page
line: Ephesians, my lord, of the old church.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Sup any women with him?

speaker: Page
line: None, my lord, but old Mistress Quickly and

speaker: Page
line: Mistress Doll Tearsheet.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: What pagan may that be?

speaker: Page
line: A proper gentlewoman, sir, and a kinswoman of my master's.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Even such kin as the parish heifers are to the town

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: bull. Shall we steal upon them, Ned, at supper?

speaker: POINS
line: I am your shadow, my lord; I'll follow you.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Sirrah, you boy, and Bardolph, no word to your

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: master that I am yet come to town: there's for

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: your silence.

speaker: BARDOLPH
line: I have no tongue, sir.

speaker: Page
line: And for mine, sir, I will govern it.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Fare you well; go.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: This Doll Tearsheet should be some road.

speaker: POINS
line: I warrant you, as common as the way between Saint

speaker: POINS
line: Alban's and London.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: How might we see Falstaff bestow himself to-night

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: in his true colours, and not ourselves be seen?

speaker: POINS
line: Put on two leathern jerkins and aprons, and wait

speaker: POINS
line: upon him at his table as drawers.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: From a God to a bull? a heavy decension! it was

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Jove's case. From a prince to a prentice? a low

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: transformation! that shall be mine; for in every

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: thing the purpose must weigh with the folly.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Follow me, Ned.

scene: SCENE II.  Gloucestershire. Before SHALLOW'S house.

line: Stand from him. Give him air; he'll straight be well.

scene: SCENE IV.  Westminster. The Jerusalem Chamber.
speaker: CLARENCE
line: No, no, he cannot long hold out these pangs:

scene: SCENE IV.  Westminster. The Jerusalem Chamber.
speaker: CLARENCE
line: The incessant care and labour of his mind

scene: SCENE IV.  Westminster. The Jerusalem Chamber.
speaker: CLARENCE
line: Hath wrought the mure that should confine it in

scene: SCENE IV.  Westminster. The Jerusalem Chamber.
speaker: CLARENCE
line: So thin that life looks through and will break out.

scene: SCENE IV.  Westminster. The Jerusalem Chamber.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: The people fear me; for they do observe

scene: SCENE IV.  Westminster. The Jerusalem Chamber.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Unfather'd heirs and loathly births of nature:

scene: SCENE IV.  Westminster. The Jerusalem Chamber.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: The seasons change their manners, as the year

scene: SCENE IV.  Westminster. The Jerusalem Chamber.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Had found some months asleep and leap'd them over.

scene: SCENE IV.  Westminster. The Jerusalem Chamber.
speaker: CLARENCE
line: The river hath thrice flow'd, no ebb between;

scene: SCENE IV.  Westminster. The Jerusalem Chamber.
speaker: CLARENCE
line: And the old folk, time's doting chronicles,

scene: SCENE IV.  Westminster. The Jerusalem Chamber.
speaker: CLARENCE
line: Say it did so a little time before

scene: SCENE IV.  Westminster. The Jerusalem Chamber.
speaker: CLARENCE
line: That our great-grandsire, Edward, sick'd and died.

scene: SCENE IV.  Westminster. The Jerusalem Chamber.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Speak lower, princes, for the king recovers.

scene: SCENE IV.  Westminster. The Jerusalem Chamber.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: This apoplexy will certain be his end.

scene: SCENE IV.  Westminster. The Jerusalem Chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: I pray you, take me up, and bear me hence

scene: SCENE IV.  Westminster. The Jerusalem Chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Into some other chamber: softly, pray.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Let there be no noise made, my gentle friends;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Unless some dull and favourable hand

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Will whisper music to my weary spirit.

speaker: WARWICK
line: Call for the music in the other room.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Set me the crown upon my pillow here.

speaker: CLARENCE
line: His eye is hollow, and he changes much.

speaker: WARWICK
line: Less noise, less noise!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Who saw the Duke of Clarence?

speaker: CLARENCE
line: I am here, brother, full of heaviness.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: How now! rain within doors, and none abroad!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: How doth the king?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Exceeding ill.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Heard he the good news yet?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Tell it him.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: He alter'd much upon the hearing it.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: If he be sick with joy, he'll recover without physic.

speaker: WARWICK
line: Not so much noise, my lords: sweet prince,

speaker: WARWICK
line: speak low;

speaker: WARWICK
line: The king your father is disposed to sleep.

speaker: CLARENCE
line: Let us withdraw into the other room.

speaker: WARWICK
line: Will't please your grace to go along with us?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: No; I will sit and watch here by the king.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Why doth the crown lie there upon his pillow,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Being so troublesome a bedfellow?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: O polish'd perturbation! golden care!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: That keep'st the ports of slumber open wide

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: To many a watchful night! sleep with it now!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Yet not so sound and half so deeply sweet

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: As he whose brow with homely biggen bound

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Snores out the watch of night. O majesty!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: When thou dost pinch thy bearer, thou dost sit

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Like a rich armour worn in heat of day,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: That scalds with safety. By his gates of breath

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: There lies a downy feather which stirs not:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Did he suspire, that light and weightless down

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Perforce must move. My gracious lord! my father!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: This sleep is sound indeed, this is a sleep

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: That from this golden rigol hath divorced

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: So many English kings. Thy due from me

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Is tears and heavy sorrows of the blood,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Which nature, love, and filial tenderness,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Shall, O dear father, pay thee plenteously:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: My due from thee is this imperial crown,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Which, as immediate as thy place and blood,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Derives itself to me. Lo, here it sits,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Which God shall guard: and put the world's whole strength

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Into one giant arm, it shall not force

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: This lineal honour from me: this from thee

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Will I to mine leave, as 'tis left to me.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Warwick! Gloucester! Clarence!

speaker: CLARENCE
line: Doth the king call?

speaker: WARWICK
line: What would your majesty? How fares your grace?

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Why did you leave me here alone, my lords?

speaker: CLARENCE
line: We left the prince my brother here, my liege,

speaker: CLARENCE
line: Who undertook to sit and watch by you.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: The Prince of Wales! Where is he? let me see him:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: He is not here.

speaker: WARWICK
line: This door is open; he is gone this way.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: He came not through the chamber where we stay'd.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Where is the crown? who took it from my pillow?

speaker: WARWICK
line: When we withdrew, my liege, we left it here.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: The prince hath ta'en it hence: go, seek him out.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Is he so hasty that he doth suppose

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: My sleep my death?

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Find him, my Lord of Warwick; chide him hither.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: This part of his conjoins with my disease,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And helps to end me. See, sons, what things you are!

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: How quickly nature falls into revolt

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: When gold becomes her object!

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: For this the foolish over-careful fathers

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Have broke their sleep with thoughts, their brains with care,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Their bones with industry;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: For this they have engrossed and piled up

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: The canker'd heaps of strange-achieved gold;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: For this they have been thoughtful to invest

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Their sons with arts and martial exercises:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: When, like the bee, culling from every flower

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: The virtuous sweets,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Our thighs pack'd with wax, our mouths with honey,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: We bring it to the hive, and, like the bees,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Are murdered for our pains. This bitter taste

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Yield his engrossments to the ending father.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Now, where is he that will not stay so long

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Till his friend sickness hath determined me?

speaker: WARWICK
line: My lord, I found the prince in the next room,

speaker: WARWICK
line: Washing with kindly tears his gentle cheeks,

speaker: WARWICK
line: With such a deep demeanor in great sorrow

speaker: WARWICK
line: That tyranny, which never quaff'd but blood,

speaker: WARWICK
line: Would, by beholding him, have wash'd his knife

speaker: WARWICK
line: With gentle eye-drops. He is coming hither.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: But wherefore did he take away the crown?

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Lo, where he comes. Come hither to me, Harry.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Depart the chamber, leave us here alone.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I never thought to hear you speak again.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Thy wish was father, Harry, to that thought:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: I stay too long by thee, I weary thee.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Dost thou so hunger for mine empty chair

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: That thou wilt needs invest thee with my honours

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Before thy hour be ripe? O foolish youth!

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Thou seek'st the greatness that will o'erwhelm thee.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Stay but a little; for my cloud of dignity

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Is held from falling with so weak a wind

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: That it will quickly drop: my day is dim.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Thou hast stolen that which after some few hours

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Were thine without offence; and at my death

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Thou hast seal'd up my expectation:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Thy life did manifest thou lovedst me not,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And thou wilt have me die assured of it.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Thou hidest a thousand daggers in thy thoughts,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Which thou hast whetted on thy stony heart,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: To stab at half an hour of my life.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: What! canst thou not forbear me half an hour?

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Then get thee gone and dig my grave thyself,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And bid the merry bells ring to thine ear

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: That thou art crowned, not that I am dead.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Let all the tears that should bedew my hearse

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Be drops of balm to sanctify thy head:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Only compound me with forgotten dust

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Give that which gave thee life unto the worms.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Pluck down my officers, break my decrees;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: For now a time is come to mock at form:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Harry the Fifth is crown'd: up, vanity!

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Down, royal state! all you sage counsellors, hence!

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And to the English court assemble now,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: From every region, apes of idleness!

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Now, neighbour confines, purge you of your scum:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Have you a ruffian that will swear, drink, dance,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Revel the night, rob, murder, and commit

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: The oldest sins the newest kind of ways?

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Be happy, he will trouble you no more;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: England shall double gild his treble guilt,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: England shall give him office, honour, might;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: For the fifth Harry from curb'd licence plucks

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: The muzzle of restraint, and the wild dog

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Shall flesh his tooth on every innocent.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: O my poor kingdom, sick with civil blows!

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: When that my care could not withhold thy riots,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: What wilt thou do when riot is thy care?

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: O, thou wilt be a wilderness again,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Peopled with wolves, thy old inhabitants!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: O, pardon me, my liege! but for my tears,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: The moist impediments unto my speech,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I had forestall'd this dear and deep rebuke

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Ere you with grief had spoke and I had heard

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: The course of it so far. There is your crown;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And He that wears the crown immortally

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Long guard it yours! If I affect it more

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Than as your honour and as your renown,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Let me no more from this obedience rise,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Which my most inward true and duteous spirit

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Teacheth, this prostrate and exterior bending.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: God witness with me, when I here came in,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And found no course of breath within your majesty,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: How cold it struck my heart! If I do feign,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: O, let me in my present wildness die

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And never live to show the incredulous world

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: The noble change that I have purposed!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Coming to look on you, thinking you dead,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And dead almost, my liege, to think you were,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I spake unto this crown as having sense,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And thus upbraided it: 'The care on thee depending

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Hath fed upon the body of my father;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Therefore, thou best of gold art worst of gold:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Other, less fine in carat, is more precious,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Preserving life in medicine potable;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: But thou, most fine, most honour'd: most renown'd,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Hast eat thy bearer up.' Thus, my most royal liege,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Accusing it, I put it on my head,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: To try with it, as with an enemy

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: That had before my face murder'd my father,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: The quarrel of a true inheritor.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: But if it did infect my blood with joy,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Or swell my thoughts to any strain of pride;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: If any rebel or vain spirit of mine

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Did with the least affection of a welcome

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Give entertainment to the might of it,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Let God for ever keep it from my head

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And make me as the poorest vassal is

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: That doth with awe and terror kneel to it!

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: O my son,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: God put it in thy mind to take it hence,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: That thou mightst win the more thy father's love,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Pleading so wisely in excuse of it!

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Come hither, Harry, sit thou by my bed;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And hear, I think, the very latest counsel

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: That ever I shall breathe. God knows, my son,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: By what by-paths and indirect crook'd ways

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: I met this crown; and I myself know well

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: How troublesome it sat upon my head.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: To thee it shall descend with bitter quiet,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Better opinion, better confirmation;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: For all the soil of the achievement goes

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: With me into the earth. It seem'd in me

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: But as an honour snatch'd with boisterous hand,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And I had many living to upbraid

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: My gain of it by their assistances;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Which daily grew to quarrel and to bloodshed,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Wounding supposed peace: all these bold fears

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Thou see'st with peril I have answered;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: For all my reign hath been but as a scene

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Acting that argument: and now my death

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Changes the mode; for what in me was purchased,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Falls upon thee in a more fairer sort;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: So thou the garland wear'st successively.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Yet, though thou stand'st more sure than I could do,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Thou art not firm enough, since griefs are green;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And all my friends, which thou must make thy friends,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Have but their stings and teeth newly ta'en out;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: By whose fell working I was first advanced

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And by whose power I well might lodge a fear

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: To be again displaced: which to avoid,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: I cut them off; and had a purpose now

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: To lead out many to the Holy Land,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Lest rest and lying still might make them look

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Too near unto my state. Therefore, my Harry,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Be it thy course to busy giddy minds

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: With foreign quarrels; that action, hence borne out,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: May waste the memory of the former days.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: More would I, but my lungs are wasted so

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: That strength of speech is utterly denied me.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: How I came by the crown, O God forgive;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And grant it may with thee in true peace live!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: My gracious liege,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: You won it, wore it, kept it, gave it me;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Then plain and right must my possession be:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Which I with more than with a common pain

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: 'Gainst all the world will rightfully maintain.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Look, look, here comes my John of Lancaster.

speaker: LANCASTER
line: Health, peace, and happiness to my royal father!

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Thou bring'st me happiness and peace, son John;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: But health, alack, with youthful wings is flown

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: From this bare wither'd trunk: upon thy sight

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: My worldly business makes a period.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Where is my Lord of Warwick?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: My Lord of Warwick!

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Doth any name particular belong

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Unto the lodging where I first did swoon?

speaker: WARWICK
line: 'Tis call'd Jerusalem, my noble lord.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Laud be to God! even there my life must end.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: It hath been prophesied to me many years,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: I should not die but in Jerusalem;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Which vainly I supposed the Holy Land:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: But bear me to that chamber; there I'll lie;

speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: In that Jerusalem shall Harry die.

speaker: SHALLOW
line: By cock and pie, sir, you shall not away to-night.

speaker: SHALLOW
line: What, Davy, I say!

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: You must excuse me, Master Robert Shallow.

speaker: SHALLOW
line: I will not excuse you; you shall not be excused;

speaker: SHALLOW
line: excuses shall not be admitted; there is no excuse

speaker: SHALLOW
line: shall serve; you shall not be excused. Why, Davy!

speaker: DAVY
line: Here, sir.

speaker: SHALLOW
line: Davy, Davy, Davy, Davy, let me see, Davy; let me

speaker: SHALLOW
line: see, Davy; let me see: yea, marry, William cook,

speaker: SHALLOW
line: bid him come hither. Sir John, you shall not be excused.

speaker: DAVY
line: Marry, sir, thus; those precepts cannot be served:

speaker: DAVY
line: and, again, sir, shall we sow the headland with wheat?

speaker: SHALLOW
line: With red wheat, Davy. But for William cook: are

speaker: SHALLOW
line: there no young pigeons?

speaker: DAVY
line: Yes, sir. Here is now the smith's note for shoeing

speaker: DAVY
line: and plough-irons.

speaker: SHALLOW
line: Let it be cast and paid. Sir John, you shall not be excused.

speaker: DAVY
line: Now, sir, a new link to the bucket must need be

speaker: DAVY
line: had: and, sir, do you mean to stop any of William's

speaker: DAVY
line: wages, about the sack he lost the other day at

speaker: DAVY
line: Hinckley fair?

speaker: SHALLOW
line: A' shall answer it. Some pigeons, Davy, a couple

speaker: SHALLOW
line: of short-legged hens, a joint of mutton, and any

speaker: SHALLOW
line: pretty little tiny kickshaws, tell William cook.

speaker: DAVY
line: Doth the man of war stay all night, sir?

speaker: SHALLOW
line: Yea, Davy. I will use him well: a friend i' the

speaker: SHALLOW
line: court is better than a penny in purse. Use his men

speaker: SHALLOW
line: well, Davy; for they are arrant knaves, and will backbite.

speaker: DAVY
line: No worse than they are backbitten, sir; for they

speaker: DAVY
line: have marvellous foul linen.

speaker: SHALLOW
line: Well conceited, Davy: about thy business, Davy.

speaker: DAVY
line: I beseech you, sir, to countenance William Visor of

speaker: DAVY
line: Woncot against Clement Perkes of the hill.

speaker: SHALLOW
line: There is many complaints, Davy, against that Visor:

speaker: SHALLOW
line: that Visor is an arrant knave, on my knowledge.

speaker: DAVY
line: I grant your worship that he is a knave, sir; but

speaker: DAVY
line: yet, God forbid, sir, but a knave should have some

speaker: DAVY
line: countenance at his friend's request. An honest

speaker: DAVY
line: man, sir, is able to speak for himself, when a knave

speaker: DAVY
line: is not. I have served your worship truly, sir,

speaker: DAVY
line: this eight years; and if I cannot once or twice in

speaker: DAVY
line: a quarter bear out a knave against an honest man, I

speaker: DAVY
line: have but a very little credit with your worship. The

speaker: DAVY
line: knave is mine honest friend, sir; therefore, I

speaker: DAVY
line: beseech your worship, let him be countenanced.

speaker: SHALLOW
line: Go to; I say he shall have no wrong. Look about, Davy.

speaker: SHALLOW
line: Where are you, Sir John? Come, come, come, off

speaker: SHALLOW
line: with your boots. Give me your hand, Master Bardolph.

speaker: BARDOLPH
line: I am glad to see your worship.

speaker: SHALLOW
line: I thank thee with all my heart, kind

speaker: SHALLOW
line: Master Bardolph: and welcome, my tall fellow.

speaker: SHALLOW
line: Come, Sir John.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: I'll follow you, good Master Robert Shallow.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Bardolph, look to our horses.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: If I were sawed into quantities, I should make four

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: dozen of such bearded hermits' staves as Master

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Shallow. It is a wonderful thing to see the

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: semblable coherence of his men's spirits and his:

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: they, by observing of him, do bear themselves like

speaker: FALSTAFF

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Come here, Pistol; stand behind me. O, if I had had

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: time to have made new liveries, I would have

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: bestowed the thousand pound I borrowed of you. But

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: 'tis no matter; this poor show doth better: this

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: doth infer the zeal I had to see him.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: SHALLOW
line: It doth so.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: It shows my earnestness of affection,--

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: SHALLOW
line: It doth so.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: My devotion,--

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: SHALLOW
line: It doth, it doth, it doth.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: As it were, to ride day and night; and not to

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: deliberate, not to remember, not to have patience

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: to shift me,--

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: SHALLOW
line: It is best, certain.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: But to stand stained with travel, and sweating with

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: desire to see him; thinking of nothing else,

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: putting all affairs else in oblivion, as if there

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: were nothing else to be done but to see him.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: PISTOL
line: 'Tis 'semper idem,' for 'obsque hoc nihil est:'

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: PISTOL
line: 'tis all in every part.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: SHALLOW
line: 'Tis so, indeed.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: PISTOL
line: My knight, I will inflame thy noble liver,

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: PISTOL
line: And make thee rage.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Thy Doll, and Helen of thy noble thoughts,

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Is in base durance and contagious prison;

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Haled thither

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: PISTOL
line: By most mechanical and dirty hand:

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Rouse up revenge from ebon den with fell

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Alecto's snake,

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: PISTOL
line: For Doll is in. Pistol speaks nought but truth.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: I will deliver her.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: PISTOL
line: There roar'd the sea, and trumpet-clangor sounds.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: God save thy grace, King Hal! my royal Hal!

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: PISTOL
line: The heavens thee guard and keep, most royal imp of fame!

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: God save thee, my sweet boy!

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: My lord chief-justice, speak to that vain man.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: Have you your wits? know you what 'tis to speak?

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: My king! my Jove! I speak to thee, my heart!

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: I know thee not, old man: fall to thy prayers;

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: How ill white hairs become a fool and jester!

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: I have long dream'd of such a kind of man,

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: So surfeit-swell'd, so old and so profane;

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: But, being awaked, I do despise my dream.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Make less thy body hence, and more thy grace;

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Leave gormandizing; know the grave doth gape

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: For thee thrice wider than for other men.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Reply not to me with a fool-born jest:

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Presume not that I am the thing I was;

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: For God doth know, so shall the world perceive,

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: That I have turn'd away my former self;

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: So will I those that kept me company.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: When thou dost hear I am as I have been,

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Approach me, and thou shalt be as thou wast,

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: The tutor and the feeder of my riots:

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Till then, I banish thee, on pain of death,

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: As I have done the rest of my misleaders,

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Not to come near our person by ten mile.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: For competence of life I will allow you,

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: That lack of means enforce you not to evil:

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And, as we hear you do reform yourselves,

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: We will, according to your strengths and qualities,

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Give you advancement. Be it your charge, my lord,

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: To see perform'd the tenor of our word. Set on.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Master Shallow, I owe you a thousand pound.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: SHALLOW
line: Yea, marry, Sir John; which I beseech you to let me

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: SHALLOW
line: have home with me.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: That can hardly be, Master Shallow. Do not you

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: grieve at this; I shall be sent for in private to

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: him: look you, he must seem thus to the world:

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: fear not your advancements; I will be the man yet

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: that shall make you great.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: SHALLOW
line: I cannot well perceive how, unless you should give

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: SHALLOW
line: me your doublet and stuff me out with straw. I

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: SHALLOW
line: beseech you, good Sir John, let me have five hundred

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: SHALLOW
line: of my thousand.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Sir, I will be as good as my word: this that you

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: heard was but a colour.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: SHALLOW
line: A colour that I fear you will die in, Sir John.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Fear no colours: go with me to dinner: come,

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Lieutenant Pistol; come, Bardolph: I shall be sent

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: for soon at night.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: Go, carry Sir John Falstaff to the Fleet:

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: Take all his company along with him.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: My lord, my lord,--

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: I cannot now speak: I will hear you soon.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: Take them away.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Si fortune me tormenta, spero contenta.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: LANCASTER
line: I like this fair proceeding of the king's:

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: LANCASTER
line: He hath intent his wonted followers

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: LANCASTER
line: Shall all be very well provided for;

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: LANCASTER
line: But all are banish'd till their conversations

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: LANCASTER
line: Appear more wise and modest to the world.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: And so they are.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: LANCASTER
line: The king hath call'd his parliament, my lord.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: Lord Chief-Justice
line: He hath.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: LANCASTER
line: I will lay odds that, ere this year expire,

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: LANCASTER
line: We bear our civil swords and native fire

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: LANCASTER
line: As far as France: I heard a bird so sing,

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: LANCASTER
line: Whose music, to my thinking, pleased the king.

scene: SCENE V.  A public place near Westminster Abbey.
speaker: LANCASTER
line: Come, will you hence?
